image.altText: Photo of people holding umbrellas in the rain.

props.synopsis: A bomb cyclone off the NSW coast is bringing hazardous surf conditions, strong winds and heavy rain that threatens to cause flash flooding. Follow live.

title.children: Evacuation warnings issued for NSW coastal properties, 16,000 without power

image.altText: A court room hearing for the Yoorrook Justice Commission

props.synopsis: One hundred recommendations are handed down as Australia's first truth-telling inquiry finds crimes against humanity and genocide were committed against Aboriginal people in Victoria.

title.children: Breaking: Truth-telling inquiry recommends redress for Aboriginal Victorians

image.altText: man in suit smiling next to man in sports jacket with grey hair in golf buggy

props.synopsis: Critics have accused South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas of "shafting" Adelaide City Council after the government legislated to take over the city's urban golf course

title.children: 'Keeps the plebs happy': SA premier at centre of golf controversy

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with toys.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne man has been charged with 70 offences related to eight alleged victims between April 2022 and January 2023.

title.children: Childcare worker charged with 70 offences, 1,200 kids to undergo health screening

image.altText: The exterior of the Early Gardens childcare centre in Point Cook.

props.synopsis: A health response has been initiated in Victoria after a childcare worker was charged with sexual assault offences against eight children at a south-west Melbourne facility. Here's what authorities have said.

title.children: What parents need to know about the Melbourne childcare allegations

image.altText: Donald Trump close up with two men behind him

props.synopsis: After just five months in power, US President Donald Trump predictably has driven a wrecking ball through the foundations of American society. In recent weeks, he's re-opened an old front from his first term, the independence of the US Federal Reserve.

title.children: Is Trump about to create the next great financial crisis?

image.altText: Paetongtarn Shinawatra stands with her hand in a wai with a microphone flanked by a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: Thailand's Constitutional Court suspends Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra from duty pending a case seeking her dismissal.

title.children: Thai prime minister suspended pending court case seeking her dismissal

image.altText: An empty beach shaded by palm trees

props.synopsis: Thai authorities have alleged militants from the country's southern Malay-Muslim insurgency planted improvised explosives at 11 sites in Phuket and Krabi.

title.children: Travel warning for Thailand after 'explosives' planted across tourism areas

image.altText: Donald Trump announces tariffs

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's attempt to "make America wealthy again" by imposing tariffs put the world on the brink of a financial crisis. With a three-month pause ending within days, trade experts are warning the global economy could be plunged into turmoil.

title.children: 'It's a very strange strategy': Trump's tariffs are backfiring on the US economy

image.altText: A black-and-white image of a smiling, dark-haired man reacting as a soft toy is pushed towards his face.

props.synopsis: The film and television actor is being remembered for his versatility, humbleness and generosity after his death on the Gold Coast.

title.children: Actor and original Play School presenter Donald MacDonald dead at 86

image.altText: Elon Musk wears a black baseball cap that says 'DOGE'.

props.synopsis: The reference to DOGE, Mr Musk's former government agency, suggests a widening fight between the president and his former supporter.

title.children: Trump suggests DOGE look at Musk subsidies to save money

image.altText: Two young influencers sit smiling in front of a cake, with a toddler whose face is blurred.

props.synopsis: Family influencers are big business and, despite our looming ban facing under-16s on social media, it's an industry that still goes largely unregulated here in Australia.

title.children: Popular Aussie family influencers call for more online protection for kids

image.altText: Taylor Fritz shouts while sitting in his chair on court at Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: Men's fifth seed Taylor Fritz is left fuming after Wimbledon officials postpone his first-round clash with Giovanni Mpetshi-Perricard despite there being plenty of time left before the tournament's 11pm curfew.

title.children: Wimbledon thriller stopped 45 minutes before grand slam's curfew

image.altText: A young man in a red football shirt stands besides the twisted frame of a building destroyed by an explosion.

props.synopsis: The number of journalists killed in Gaza rises as Israeli air strikes target a cafe in Gaza known for its public internet connection.

title.children: At least 30 dead in Israeli strike on Gaza cafe popular with journalists

image.altText: A young, bearded man with ginger hair smiles while standing on a country property.

props.synopsis: Adam Sutton had just collected his six-year-old son from his first day of school when they were involved in collision with Peter Agius, 23, in Gippsland in 2023.

title.children: Driver who killed young dad denies Snapchat distraction, court hears

image.altText: A riverbank, as seen from a distance, with a crocodile basking on it.

props.synopsis: Authorities spent a week trying to capture the animal after it was seen in the Maryborough area, about 200 kilometres away from its usual habitat.

title.children: Crocodile euthanased after being spotted in atypical habitat

image.altText: A photo of Erin Patterson looking distressed.

props.synopsis: As a jury considers its verdicts in the Erin Patterson triple-murder trial, here's a recap of some of the evidence put before them.

title.children: The evidence laid before the jury in Erin Patterson's trial

image.altText: Two men in white windbreakers hold microphones and smile. One wears a keffiyeh around his neck.

props.synopsis: With more than 200,000 people taking in over 3,000 performances, Glastonbury always offers plenty to talk about. This year was all about protest, secret sets and... Doctor Who

title.children: Amyl and the Sniffers defend Kneecap, Bob Vylan Glastonbury protests

image.altText: Five girls stand close to each other on a sunny porch

props.synopsis: The new development means Brian Kohberger will not go to trial as planned in August, and will face four life sentences. Here's what we know.

title.children: Accused Idaho college killer to plead guilty to murders

image.altText: A black and white photo of a group of people with their faces blacked out

props.synopsis: The US Justice Department has cracked down on an alleged North Korean scheme to use remote tech workers to fund its weapons programs.

title.children: FBI says it dismantled North Korean fraud scheme spanning 16 US states

image.altText: Daryl Mundy

props.synopsis: A South Australian police sergeant of "exceptional character" has been handed a $2,000 fine for failing to stop after getting in a "minor collision" in the Adelaide CBD.

title.children: SA Police officer handed fine for 'minor' CBD collision

image.altText: Khalid al-Ghannam puts his arms out and shouts to celebrate winning a Club World Cup game.

props.synopsis: Manchester City is shocked by two extra-time goals by Al-Hilal, knocking them out of the Club World Cup in the round of 16.

title.children: Manchester City knocked out of Club World Cup in extra-time boilover

image.altText: A young Asian woman tries to do a banking operation

props.synopsis: Many Australians bank with more than one institution. Experts share whether consolidating accounts can save time or money.

title.children: What having multiple bank accounts could be costing you

image.altText: Woman wearing a black mask and sewing a pile of cargo pants.

props.synopsis: Bangladeshi garment suppliers say they are being pushed to the brink, forced to fire workers and repay bank loans of millions for clothes shipped to Australia but never paid for.

title.children: Aussie fashion giant's collapse leaves Bangladeshi workers jobless

image.altText: Man wearing a suit and black jacket standing next to a wall.

props.synopsis: There have been more than 2,000 fatal overdoses in Australia for the 10th year in a row, according to a new analysis by the Penington Institute.

title.children: The 'huge' Aussie death toll that gets 'very little attention'

image.altText: Senator Paul Scarr holds 30 year old parliamentary recommendations as he speaks on whistleblowers

props.synopsis: After the Department of Home Affairs conceded it had not been able to use laws that would see former immigration detainees placed back in detention, the Coalition has called for those laws to be amended.

title.children: Coalition demands rewrite of laws to re-detain NZYQ members

image.altText: Dom Sheed kicks a ball in the 2018 AFL grand final.

props.synopsis: Dom Sheed retires after 165 games and one of the most memorable moments in AFL history, and despite becoming the defining kick of his career, that 2018 grand final goal almost never happened.

title.children: Dom Sheed delivered one of the AFL's greatest moments. It nearly never happened

image.altText: A cardboard takeaway box on a picnic table holds golden, fried fish atop chips with a slice of lemon and tartare sauce.

props.synopsis: It is hoped new country of origin labelling for seafood on restaurant, cafe, and takeaway shop menus will give consumers certainty and help the Australian seafood industry in an import-dominated market.

title.children: New seafood labelling laws come into effect

image.altText: Cassius pictured at a horse track

props.synopsis: In Western Australia, two First Nations families are on parallel tracks, seeking justice for their teenage sons taken from them before their time. The boys should have been safe and protected — but weren't.

title.children: As two mothers mourn their sons, the silence of legislators speaks volumes

image.altText: A man in a lab coat holds up a pair of sample jars containing soil.

props.synopsis: The soil-borne disease continues to pose a threat in Queensland's north following extremely wet conditions this year.

title.children: Another melioidosis case recorded as two more deaths confirmed

image.altText: A sketch of a man sitting in court looking straight

props.synopsis: A Queensland review into child sexual abuse responses has heard defamation fears and a focus on an organisation's "reputation" may act as a deterrent to raising concerns about childcare staff.

title.children: Past complaints against paedophile childcare worker may not have been shared between agencies, review hears

image.altText: A composite image of three men wearing formal suits standing side by side.

props.synopsis: When PNG's anti-corruption watchdog was established two years ago, there were high hopes it would mark a turning point but now the Australian and New Zealand bosses have been suspended.

title.children: Australian anti-corruption bosses suspended after 'chaotic' feud

image.altText: A birds eye view of a bridge between the Port River and West Lakes

props.synopsis: The state government says preliminary samples show the toxic algal bloom that's been affecting parts of the South Australian coast has now been detected in West Lakes.

title.children: SA's toxic algal bloom continues to spread, with West Lakes and Port River to be tested

image.altText: woman on couch staring at phone

props.synopsis: Told they couldn't go out with friends. Stopped from giving male friends a hug. Called crazy and gaslit. They are just some of the early signs of intimate partner violence shared by victim-survivors.

title.children: Domestic violence survivors share early warning signs of abuse

image.altText: A laughing woman sits on a couch, holding a phone and speaking into a microphone, with indoor plants in the background.

props.synopsis: During big life changes, the weight of making the "right" decision can feel like it will make or break your future. We asked the experts how to move through that fear of regret.

title.children: This 20yo might just have the right words for your mid-life crisis
